member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.ControllerModeOverrideSubTypes
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.ControllerModeOverrideSubTypes.STANDARD_EXTENSION
member.summary: An extension to the standard. Extensions to the standard are usually prefaced with x:.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.ControllerModeOverrideSubTypes.DRY_RUN
member.summary: setting or operator selection used to execute a test mode to confirm the execution of machine functions. When DRY_RUN is ON, the equipment performs all of its normal functions, except no part or product is produced. If the equipment has a spindle, spindle operation is suspended.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.ControllerModeOverrideSubTypes.SINGLE_BLOCK
member.summary: setting or operator selection that changes the behavior of the controller on a piece of equipment. Program execution is paused after each block of code is executed when SINGLE_BLOCK is ON. When SINGLE_BLOCK is ON, Execution MUST change to INTERRUPTED after completion of each block of code.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.ControllerModeOverrideSubTypes.MACHINE_AXIS_LOCK
member.summary: setting or operator selection that changes the behavior of the controller on a piece of equipment. When MACHINE_AXIS_LOCK is ON, program execution continues normally, but no equipment motion occurs.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.ControllerModeOverrideSubTypes.OPTIONAL_STOP
member.summary: setting or operator selection that changes the behavior of the controller on a piece of equipment. The program execution is stopped after a specific program block is executed when OPTIONAL_STOP is ON. In the case of a G-Code program, a program block containing a M01 code designates the command for an OPTIONAL_STOP. Execution MUST change to OPTIONAL_STOP after a program block specifying an optional stop is executed and the ControllerModeOverride OPTIONAL_STOP selection is ON.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.ControllerModeOverrideSubTypes.TOOL_CHANGE_STOP
member.summary: setting or operator selection that changes the behavior of the controller on a piece of equipment. Program execution is paused when a command is executed requesting a cutting tool to be changed. Execution MUST change to INTERRUPTED after completion of the command requesting a cutting tool to be changed and TOOL_CHANGE_STOP is ON.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.DeactivationCountSubTypes.FAILED
member.summary: accumulation of actions or activities that were attempted, but failed to complete or resulted in an unexpected or unacceptable outcome.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.DeactivationCountSubTypes.TARGET
member.summary: goal of the operation or process.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.DeactivationCountSubTypes.COMPLETE
member.summary: accumulation of actions, items, or activities that have been completed, independent of the outcome.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.DeactivationCountSubTypes.REMAINING
member.summary: accumulation of actions, items, or activities yet to be counted.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.DeactivationCountSubTypes.ALL
member.summary: accumulation of all actions, items, or activities being counted independent of the outcome.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.DeactivationCountSubTypes.GOOD
member.summary: accumulation of actions, items, or activities being counted that conform to specification or expectation.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.DeactivationCountSubTypes.ABORTED
member.summary: accumulation of actions or activities that were attempted, but terminated before they could be completed.

member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.summary: An extension to the standard. Extensions to the standard are usually prefaced with x:.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EndOfBarSubTypes.PRIMARY
member.summary: specific applications MAY reference one or more locations on a piece of bar stock as the indication for the EndOfBar. The main or most important location MUST be designated as the PRIMARY indication for the EndOfBar. If no subType is specified, PRIMARY MUST be the default EndOfBar indication.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EndOfBarSubTypes.AUXILIARY
member.summary: when multiple locations on a piece of bar stock are referenced as the indication for the EndOfBar, the additional location(s) MUST be designated as AUXILIARY indication(s) for the EndOfBar.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.STANDARD_EXTENSION
member.summary: An extension to the standard. Extensions to the standard are usually prefaced with x:.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.LOADED
member.summary: indication that the sub-parts of a piece of equipment are under load. Example: For traditional machine tools, this is an indication that the cutting tool is assumed to be engaged with the part.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.WORKING
member.summary: indication that a piece of equipment is performing any activity, the equipment is active and performing a function under load or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes when the piece of equipment is LOADED, making rapid moves, executing a tool change, etc.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.OPERATING
member.summary: indication that the major sub-parts of a piece of equipment are powered or performing any activity whether producing a part or product or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes when the piece of equipment is WORKING or it is idle.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.POWERED
member.summary: indication that primary power is applied to the piece of equipment and, as a minimum, the controller or logic portion of the piece of equipment is powered and functioning or components that are required to remain on are powered. Example: Heaters for an extrusion machine that required to be powered even when the equipment is turned off.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.DELAY
member.summary: elapsed time of a temporary halt of action.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.STANDARD_EXTENSION
member.summary: An extension to the standard. Extensions to the standard are usually prefaced with x:.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.LOADED
member.summary: time that the sub-parts of a piece of equipment are under load. Example: For traditional machine tools, this is a measurement of the time that the cutting tool is assumed to be engaged with the part.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.WORKING
member.summary: time that a piece of equipment is performing any activity the equipment is active and performing a function under load or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes LOADED, plus rapid moves, tool changes, etc.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.OPERATING
member.summary: time that the major sub-parts of a piece of equipment are powered or performing any activity whether producing a part or product or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes WORKING, plus idle time.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.POWERED
member.summary: time that primary power is applied to the piece of equipment and, as a minimum, the controller or logic portion of the piece of equipment is powered and functioning or components that are required to remain on are powered. Example: Heaters for an extrusion machine that are required to be powered even when the equipment is turned off.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.DELAY
member.summary: elapsed time of a temporary halt of action.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.STANDARD_EXTENSION
member.summary: An extension to the standard. Extensions to the standard are usually prefaced with x:.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ACTIVE_AXES
member.summary: set of axes currently associated with a Path or Controller.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ACTUATOR_STATE
member.summary: operational state of an apparatus for moving or controlling a mechanism or system.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ALARM
member.summary: DEPRECATED: Replaced with CONDITION category data items in Version 1.1.0.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ASSET_CHANGED
member.summary: assetId of the Asset that has been added or changed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ASSET_REMOVED
member.summary: assetId of the Asset that has been removed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AVAILABILITY
member.summary: agent's ability to communicate with the data source.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AXIS_COUPLING
member.summary: describes the way the axes will be associated to each other. This is used in conjunction with COUPLED_AXES to indicate the way they are interacting.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AXIS_FEEDRATE_OVERRIDE
member.summary: value of a signal or calculation issued to adjust the feedrate of an individual linear type axis.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AXIS_INTERLOCK
member.summary: state of the axis lockout function when power has been removed and the axis is allowed to move freely.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AXIS_STATE
member.summary: state of a Linear or Rotary component representing an axis.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.BLOCK
member.summary: line of code or command being executed by a Controller entity.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.BLOCK_COUNT
member.summary: total count of the number of blocks of program code that have been executed since execution started.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CHUCK_INTERLOCK
member.summary: state of an interlock function or control logic state intended to prevent the associated Chuck component from being operated.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CHUCK_STATE
member.summary: operating state of a mechanism that holds a part or stock material during a manufacturing process. It may also represent a mechanism that holds any other mechanism in place within a piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CODE
member.summary: programmatic code being executed. DEPRECATED in Version 1.1.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.COMPOSITION_STATE
member.summary: operating state of a mechanism represented by a Composition entity.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CONTROLLER_MODE
member.summary: current mode of the Controller component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CONTROLLER_MODE_OVERRIDE
member.summary: setting or operator selection that changes the behavior of a piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.COUPLED_AXES
member.summary: set of associated axes.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DATE_CODE
member.summary: time and date code associated with a material or other physical item.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DEVICE_UUID
member.summary: identifier of another piece of equipment that is temporarily associated with a component of this piece of equipment to perform a particular function.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DIRECTION
member.summary: direction of motion.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DOOR_STATE
member.summary: operational state of a Door component or composition element.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.EMERGENCY_STOP
member.summary: state of the emergency stop signal for a piece of equipment, controller path, or any other component or subsystem of a piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.END_OF_BAR
member.summary: indication of whether the end of a piece of bar stock being feed by a bar feeder has been reached.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.EQUIPMENT_MODE
member.summary: indication that a piece of equipment, or a sub-part of a piece of equipment, is performing specific types of activities.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.EXECUTION
member.summary: execution status of the Component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.FUNCTIONAL_MODE
member.summary: current intended production status of the Component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.HARDNESS
member.summary: hardness of a material.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.LINE
member.summary: current line of code being executed. DEPRECATED in Version 1.4.0.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.LINE_LABEL
member.summary: identifier for a Block of code in a Program.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.LINE_NUMBER
member.summary: position of a block of program code within a control program.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.MATERIAL
member.summary: identifier of a material used or consumed in the manufacturing process.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.MATERIAL_LAYER
member.summary: identifies the layers of material applied to a part or product as part of an additive manufacturing process.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.MESSAGE
member.summary: information to be transferred from a piece of equipment to a client software application.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.OPERATOR_ID
member.summary: identifier of the person currently responsible for operating the piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PALLET_ID
member.summary: identifier for a pallet.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_COUNT
member.summary: aggregate count of parts.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_DETECT
member.summary: indication designating whether a part or work piece has been detected or is present.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_ID
member.summary: identifier of a part in a manufacturing operation.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_NUMBER
member.summary: identifier of a part or product moving through the manufacturing process. DEPRECATED in Version 1.7. PART_NUMBER is now a subType of PART_KIND_ID.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PATH_FEEDRATE_OVERRIDE
member.summary: value of a signal or calculation issued to adjust the feedrate for the axes associated with a Path component that may represent a single axis or the coordinated movement of multiple axes.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PATH_MODE
member.summary: describes the operational relationship between a Path entity and another Path entity for pieces of equipment comprised of multiple logical groupings of controlled axes or other logical operations.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.POWER_STATE
member.summary: indication of the status of the source of energy for an entity to allow it to perform its intended function or the state of an enabling signal providing permission for the entity to perform its functions.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.POWER_STATUS
member.summary: status of the Component. DEPRECATED in Version 1.1.0.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROCESS_TIME
member.summary: time and date associated with an activity or event.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM
member.summary: name of the logic or motion program being executed by the Controller component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM_COMMENT
member.summary: comment or non-executable statement in the control program.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM_EDIT
member.summary: indication of the status of the Controller components program editing mode. A program may be edited while another is executed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM_EDIT_NAME
member.summary: name of the program being edited. This is used in conjunction with ProgramEdit when in ACTIVE state.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM_HEADER
member.summary: non-executable header section of the control program.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM_LOCATION
member.summary: URI for the source file associated with Program.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM_LOCATION_TYPE
member.summary: defines whether the logic or motion program defined by Program is being executed from the local memory of the controller or from an outside source.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROGRAM_NEST_LEVEL
member.summary: indication of the nesting level within a control program that is associated with the code or instructions that is currently being executed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ROTARY_MODE
member.summary: current operating mode for a Rotary type axis.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ROTARY_VELOCITY_OVERRIDE
member.summary: percentage change to the velocity of the programmed velocity for a Rotary axis.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.SERIAL_NUMBER
member.summary: serial number associated with a Component, Asset, or Device.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.SPINDLE_INTERLOCK
member.summary: indication of the status of the spindle for a piece of equipment when power has been removed and it is free to rotate.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.TOOL_ASSET_ID
member.summary: identifier of an individual tool asset.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.TOOL_GROUP
member.summary: identifier for the tool group associated with a specific tool. Commonly used to designate spare tools.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.TOOL_ID
member.summary: identifier of the tool currently in use for a given Path. DEPRECATED in Version 1.2.0. See TOOL_ASSET_ID.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.TOOL_NUMBER
member.summary: identifier assigned by the Controller component to a cutting tool when in use by a piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.TOOL_OFFSET
member.summary: reference to the tool offset variables applied to the active cutting tool associated with a Path in a Controller type component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.USER
member.summary: identifier of the person currently responsible for operating the piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.VARIABLE
member.summary: data whose meaning may change over time due to changes in the operation of a piece of equipment or the process being executed on that piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.WAIT_STATE
member.summary: indication of the reason that Execution is reporting a value of WAIT.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.WIRE
member.summary: identifier for the type of wire used as the cutting mechanism in Electrical Discharge Machining or similar processes.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.WORKHOLDING_ID
member.summary: identifier for the current workholding or part clamp in use by a piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.WORK_OFFSET
member.summary: offset variables for a work piece or part associated with a Path in a Controller type component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.OPERATING_SYSTEM
member.summary: Operating System (OS) of a Component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.FIRMWARE
member.summary: embedded software of a Component .

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.APPLICATION
member.summary: application on a Component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.LIBRARY
member.summary: software library on a Component

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.HARDWARE
member.summary: hardware of a Component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.NETWORK
member.summary: network details of a Component.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ROTATION
member.summary: three space angular displacement of an object or coordinate system relative to a cartesian coordinate system.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.TRANSLATION
member.summary: three space linear displacement of an object or coordinate system relative to a cartesian coordinate system.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROCESS_KIND_ID
member.summary: identifier given to link the individual occurrence to a class of processes or process definition.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_STATUS
member.summary: state or condition of a part.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ALARM_LIMIT
member.summary: set of limits used to trigger warning or alarm indicators.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROCESS_AGGREGATE_ID
member.summary: identifier given to link the individual occurrence to a group of related occurrences, such as a process step in a process plan.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_KIND_ID
member.summary: identifier given to link the individual occurrence to a class of parts, typically distinguished by a particular part design.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ADAPTER_URI
member.summary: URI of the adapter.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DEVICE_REMOVED
member.summary: UUID of a device removed from an MTConnect Agent.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DEVICE_CHANGED
member.summary: UUID of the device whose metadata has changed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.SPECIFICATION_LIMIT
member.summary: set of limits defining a range of values designating acceptable performance for a variable.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CONNECTION_STATUS
member.summary: status of the connection between an adapter and an agent.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ADAPTER_SOFTWARE_VERSION
member.summary: originator’s software version of the adapter.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.SENSOR_ATTACHMENT
member.summary: attachment between a sensor and an entity.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CONTROL_LIMIT
member.summary: set of limits used to indicate whether a process variable is stable and in control.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DEVICE_ADDED
member.summary: UUID of new device added to an MTConnect Agent.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.MTCONNECT_VERSION
member.summary: reference version of the MTConnect Standard supported by the adapter.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PROCESS_OCCURRENCE_ID
member.summary: identifier of a process being executed by the device.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_GROUP_ID
member.summary: identifier given to a collection of individual parts.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.PART_UNIQUE_ID
member.summary: identifier given to a distinguishable, individual part.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.ACTIVATION_COUNT
member.summary: accumulation of the number of times a function has attempted to, or is planned to attempt to, activate or be performed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.DEACTIVATION_COUNT
member.summary: accumulation of the number of times a function has attempted to, or is planned to attempt to, deactivate or cease.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.TRANSFER_COUNT
member.summary: accumulation of the number of times an operation has attempted to, or is planned to attempt to, transfer materials, parts, or other items from one location to another.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses
member.summary: Indicators for what may contribute to timestamp drift

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses.None
member.summary: There are no drift causes or they are unknown.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses.ClockDrift
member.summary: Timestamp drift can occur when clocks on different systems are not perfectly synchronized. This can cause timestamps generated on one system to be slightly different from the actual time of the event.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses.DiskWrite
member.summary: Timestamp drift can occur due to the time it takes to write data to disk, as the actual time of the event may be slightly different from the time recorded in the timestamp.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses.DiskRead
member.summary: Disk read time refers to the amount of time it takes to read data from disk. If a system is reading a timestamp from disk to determine the time of an event, the actual time of the event may be slightly different from the time recorded in the timestamp due to the disk read time. This can cause timestamp drift, as the actual time of the event and the time recorded in the timestamp may not be perfectly synchronized.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses.InterruptHandlingDelay
member.summary: Timestamp drift can occur due to the time it takes for a system to handle an interrupt, which can cause inaccuracies in timestamps generated by the system.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses.NetworkDelay
member.summary: Timestamp drift can occur due to the amount of time it takes for a network packet to travel from the source to the destination. This delay can cause the actual time of the event to be different from the time recorded in the timestamp.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampDriftCauses.CpuJitter
member.summary: Timestamp drift can occur due to small variations in the time it takes for a CPU to perform operations, which can cause inaccuracies in timestamps generated by the system.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampResolutionTypes
member.summary: Indicators for how accurate the timestamp may be to the true occurance of an event.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampResolutionTypes.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates that the accuracy of a timestamp is not known or quantifiable.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampResolutionTypes.None
member.summary: Indicates that there is perfect resolution (or real-time)

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampResolutionTypes.Fine
member.summary: Indicates that the accuracy of a timestamp is high.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampResolutionTypes.Coarse
member.summary: Indicates that the accuracy of a timestamp is low.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampSyncTypes
member.summary: Indicates the methodology used for ensuring the DateTime is accurate to standards.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampSyncTypes.Unknown
member.summary: The methodology for time synchronization is not known.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampSyncTypes.None
member.summary: Indicates that no time synchronization is used for a timestamp.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampSyncTypes.NTP
member.summary: Network Time Protocol, uses a hierarchical architecture with a small number of highly accurate references clocks at the top and large number of less accurate clocks at the bottom. NTP clients use the NTP protocol to synchronize their clocks with the closest NTP server.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampSyncTypes.PTP
member.summary: Precision Time Protocol, designed specifically for industrial and scientific application where high precision time synchronization is required. PTP operates over Ethernet networks and uses a master-slave architecture to synchronize clocks.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampSyncTypes.GPS
member.summary: Global Positioning System is a satellite-based navigation system that can be used for time synchronization in some situations. GPS receivers use the timing signals from GPS satellites to synchronize their clocks.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.TimestampSyncTypes.DCF77
member.summary: Deutsche Funkturm is a longwave time signal service transmitted from a radio transmitter located in Frankfurt, Germany. DCF77 can be used for time synchronization in Europe.

member.name: T:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.ValidationLevel
member.summary: Varying levels of validation message criticalities.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.ValidationLevel.ERROR
member.summary: There is a clear violation against the standard.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.ValidationLevel.WARNING
member.summary: There is a slight violation against the standard that perhaps goes against recommendation.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.ValidationLevel.MESSAGE
member.summary: There is no violation against the standard.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.ValidationLevel.VALID
member.summary: The implementation is indicated as valid.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.NEEDS_PROCESSING
member.summary: part occurrence is not actively being processed, but the processing has not ended. Processing requirements exist that have not yet been fulfilled. This is the default entry state when the part occurrence is originally received. In some cases, the part occurrence may return to this state while it waits for additional processing to be performed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.IN_PROCESS
member.summary: part occurrence is actively being processed.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED
member.summary: part occurrence is no longer being processed. A general state when the reason for termination is unknown.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_COMPLETE
member.summary: part occurrence has completed processing successfully.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_STOPPED
member.summary: process has been stopped during the processing. The part occurrence will require special treatment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_ABORTED
member.summary: processing of the part occurrence has come to a premature end.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_LOST
member.summary: terminal state when the part occurrence has been removed from the equipment by an external entity and it no longer exists at the equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_SKIPPED
member.summary: part occurrence has been skipped for processing on the piece of equipment.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_REJECTED
member.summary: part occurrence has been processed completely. However, the processing may have a problem.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.WAITING_FOR_TRANSIT
member.summary: part occurrence is waiting for transit.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.IN_TRANSIT
member.summary: part occurrence is being transported to its destination.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.PartProcessingStateValues.TRANSIT_COMPLETE
member.summary: part occurrence has been placed at its designated destination.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.POWERING_DOWN

member.summary: execution is waiting while one or more discrete workpieces are being loaded.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.PART_UNLOAD
member.summary: execution is waiting while one or more discrete workpieces are being unloaded.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.TOOL_LOAD
member.summary: execution is waiting while a tool or tooling is being loaded.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.TOOL_UNLOAD
member.summary: execution is waiting while a tool or tooling is being unloaded.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.MATERIAL_LOAD
member.summary: execution is waiting while material is being loaded.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.MATERIAL_UNLOAD
member.summary: execution is waiting while material is being unloaded.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.SECONDARY_PROCESS
member.summary: execution is waiting while another process is completed before the execution can resume.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.PAUSING
member.summary: execution is waiting while the equipment is pausing but the piece of equipment has not yet reached a fully paused state.

member.name: F:Mtconnect.AdapterSdk.DataItemValues.WaitStateValues.RESUMING
member.summary: execution is waiting while the equipment is resuming the production cycle but has not yet resumed execution.

member.summary:
Flags whether or not the Adapter can store reported DataItem value from its source. The internal queue can ensure that all values reported from the data source are pushed thru the implemented stream.
Setting this to false will automatically send the entire queue thru the stream.
